units.name: Phantom
units.prompt: Cloak immediately on turn 1. Move toward the enemy medic or weakest target. Use shadow_strike when adjacent while cloaked. Use breach to sabotage high-value targets.

units.name: Bolt
units.prompt: Maintain distance. Use precision_shot on high-value targets — medics first, then damage dealers. Use suppressing_fire if enemies close in.

units.name: Patch
units.prompt: Keep your frontliner alive with patch. Stay behind them for cover. Overclock your striker or specter when no healing is needed.

units.name: Phantom
units.prompt: Cloak and move behind enemy lines. Target isolated enemies with shadow_strike. Save breach for the most dangerous enemy. Avoid being caught uncloaked.

units.name: Bastion
units.prompt: Advance toward the nearest enemy. Use shield_wall facing the direction with the most enemies. If an enemy is adjacent, attack them.

units.name: Weaver
units.prompt: Control chokepoints with traps. Place them between enemy positions and your allies. Use denial to block adjacent enemy abilities. Pulse groups when possible.

actions.thinking: Round 1 — cloak immediately as ordered. Then advance toward Phantom at (4,5) which is closest enemy and directly north. Move to (4,4) to close distance while cloaked.
Round 1 — cloak immediately as advised. Enemies are far (dist 5-6). Move toward Bolt at (5,1) to close distance while cloaked. Best move is toward (5,4) to advance while staying safe.

Both enemies are out of range (Weaver at dist 5, Bastion at dist 7). My max range is 2. I need to close distance while maintaining safety. Moving to (5,3) gets me closer to Weaver without exposing myself. Still out of range after moving, so I'll wait as second action.

Round 1, all allies at full HP so no healing needed. Enemies are far (Weaver at dist 4, Bastion at dist 6). I should advance toward my allies to be in position to support them. Moving to (3,2) gets me closer to center while staying behind my frontliners. No abilities useful this turn - can't overclock anyone (not adjacent), can't heal (full HP). Just advance.

Patch (medic) is at (3,2), distance 2 — within trap range. I'm at (3,4). I can place a trap at (3,3) to block Patch's advance toward our allies. Then I'll move to (4,4) to maintain pressure and position myself between enemies and our backline. Bolt is out of range at distance 3. Placing trap on Patch's likely path is high value.

No enemies adjacent, so no attack. Advance toward nearest enemy (Patch at dist=4). Move to (2,3) gets me closer. Enemies are generally to the east/south, so shield_wall facing E or S makes sense. Most enemies visible are to the south-east. I'll move toward Patch, then use shield_wall facing E to protect allies.
Bolt is directly adjacent at (5,3) facing N. I can move to (5,2) which is behind Bolt, then shadow_strike to deal damage while maintaining cloak. This sets up a breach next turn if needed.

I'm cloaked with 2 turns remaining. Weaver is adjacent at (3,4) and has DENIAL active, blocking my abilities. I need to move away from Weaver's denial zone first. If I move to (3,5), I'll be behind Weaver and adjacent — but I'm still in denial range after moving there. Better to move to (4,5) to clear denial, then I can use shadow_strike or breach next turn. Actually, (3,5) is behind Weaver and adjacent — after I move there, the denial check would be based on new position. The warning says denial blocks abilities, so I should move first to get behind Weaver at (3,5), then attempt shadow_strike. Shadow_strike keeps cloak, so that's ideal. Since I move first then use ability, moving to (3,5) puts me behind+adjacent to Weaver — but denial is based on adjacency to Weaver, and (3,5) is still adjacent to Weaver at (3,4). However, breach is what gets blocked by Vector denial — shadow_strike is a basic melee strike that might still work. The warning says 'only basic attack/movement work' in denial zone. Shadow_strike is essentially a cloaked attack, similar to basic attack. I'll move to (3,5) behind Weaver and use shadow_strike to deal 1 damage while staying cloaked.

Orders say medics first, then damage dealers. No enemy medic visible. Weaver (vector) is highest priority to neutralize — denies my abilities if adjacent. Both Bastion and Weaver are at dist=3, within precision_shot range=2... wait, precision_shot range is ≤2 tiles and they're at dist=3, so out of range from current position. I need to close to dist≤2 but stay away from Weaver (must not go adjacent to Weaver at 3,4). Weaver is at (3,4). Moving to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Weaver — blocked. Moving to (4,3) puts me at dist=1 from Weaver(3,4) — adjacent, bad. Moving to (4,2) puts me at dist ~2.2 from Weaver(3,4) — not adjacent. From (4,2): dist to Weaver(3,4) = sqrt(1+4)=2.2, not adjacent. Dist to Bastion(2,3) = sqrt(4+1)=2.2, out of precision_shot range (≤2). Move to (5,2): dist to Weaver = sqrt(4+4)=2.8, not adjacent. Dist to Bastion = sqrt(9+1)=3.16, still out of range. Staying at (5,3) lets me use precision_shot on both at dist=3 — but precision_shot max range is 2 tiles, so dist=3 is out of range. I cannot reach either with precision_shot this turn without risk. Best to hold position and wait — maintain distance per orders, use suppressing_fire if they close. Actually wait — let me check suppressing_fire: range ≤2 tiles, so also out of range. No good shots available. Hold position.

Bolt is wounded at 4/5 HP and 3 tiles away. I need to close distance to heal. Moving to (4,3) gets me adjacent to Bolt at (5,3). Weaver is at (3,4) - I must avoid moving adjacent to Weaver. (4,3) is diagonal from Weaver so dist=1 which is adjacent - that would block my abilities. Let me check: Weaver at (3,4), moving to (4,3) = distance is |4-3|+|3-4|=1+1=2, not adjacent, safe. From (4,3) I can heal Bolt at (5,3) which is adjacent.

Trap at (3,3) is already placed. Patch is at (4,3) distance 2, within range. I'm at (3,4). I can move to (4,4) to get adjacent to Patch, denying their abilities. Then pulse to hit Patch for 1 damage. Moving to (4,4) puts me adjacent to Patch at (4,3), activating Denial on them. Then pulse hits all units within 1 tile - Patch at (4,3) takes 1 damage.

No enemies adjacent, so no attack. Orders say advance toward nearest enemy and use shield_wall facing direction with most enemies. Patch is nearest at dist=2 to my east. I can move to (3,3) but there's a trap there. Moving to (3,2) gets me closer without trap. But wait - valid moves include (3,2) and (3,4). Moving to (3,2) brings me closer to Patch at (4,3). Then shield_wall facing E covers Patch and Bolt both to the east. However, moving breaks Fortify. Better to stay put and shield_wall E to protect allies? Orders say advance though. I'll move to (3,2) to close distance, then shield_wall E since both enemies are to the east.

Cloak expires after this turn. Weaver is 2 tiles away at (4,4) facing E — I'm already behind them. Moving to (3,4) puts me adjacent and behind Weaver for breach. Breaching Weaver (a vector that blocks abilities) would neutralize their denial field for a turn, opening up my allies. This is high value — use the last cloaked turn to breach Weaver.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from allies, toward the edge of the map

actions.secondResult: Cannot use breach — adjacent to enemy Vector (Denial)

Patch is adjacent at (3,3) to my north. Orders say attack if enemy is adjacent. I'm fortified but orders say advance — attacking Patch first uses my ability, then I can stay put to keep fortify or move. Since Patch is right there, attack first. Round 4, full HP, breach ready. Phantom enemy is at (4,3) facing N — I can reach (4,2) which is behind them and adjacent. From there I can breach to take control of Phantom next turn, which is high value (specter). Move to (4,2) then breach Phantom. Weaver is 3 tiles away so no denial risk at (4,2).
